job_description: Senior Manager I, Product Management, IVR - job post Walmart 242,951 reviews 950 Elm Ave, San Bruno, CA $112,000 - $192,000 a year -  Part-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Salary $112,000 - $192,000 a year Job Type Part-time In addition to base salary, Walmart total compensation may also include bonus incentives, stock options, and more. Position Summary... What you'll do... Senior Manager, Product Management - Automation (Conversational IVR) Overview Customer Product plays a key role in shaping the future of our customer experience for customers of Walmart by recommending and championing products, processes, and solutions. We are focusing on emerging technologies to drive transformative digital experiences, personalization and simplification and are looking for a curious and driven Senior Product Manager with a track record of launching and managing successful products from concept to market to help drive our long-term AI/ML strategy for the next generation of our platform to empower human understanding at scale. As a member of the Customer Product organization, the Senior Manager, Product Management - Automation will work with engineers, data scientists, business partners, peer product managers, and other functions to meet product goals and build the tools and infrastructure to support the product analytics program strategy and next-generation artificial intelligence platform and create great experiences for both internal users and Walmart customers. Example problems you will help solve. For customers, how can Walmart anticipate a customer's need before they contact customer service to provide a personalized experience? For agents, how can we build intelligence in Walmart's homegrown CRM to guide agents to the optimal resolution for customers and the business? For product managers, how can we build tools and data assets to help our product teams understand opportunities with the largest ROI? For the business, how can we expand use cases of Automation and AI/Machine Learning and establish a feedback loop from Customer Care Agents and Customers to identify pain points and improvement opportunities? Responsibilities Work with Product leadership and the rest of the Automation team to define and execute Automation Platform and Data strategy roadmap and vision, supporting Walmart's current needs and deciding what Walmart should invest in to position itself for the future Shape the direction of Automation products by applying advanced analytics and technologies to make them more efficient, and intelligent Build out a set of data tools, mapping, documentation, and automate data cleansing/reporting jobs to empower our team to uncover insights Identify the drivers of critical metrics and KPIs and provide business recommendations accordingly Work directly with engineering teams using Agile methodologies to develop, maintain, and execute against product roadmap and lead prioritization with stakeholders to ensure benefit realization Collaborate with key stakeholders including but not limited to Customer Care Operations, Engineering, vertical business leaders and legal throughout the product life cycle. Partner closely with Analytics and Operations teams to ensure proper measurement instrumentation, monitoring and reporting of product success post launch Communicate plans and progress to leadership and partner teams Evangelize Automation/AI across the organization, drive new emerging technology integration, and identify new product innovation opportunities based on market trends and customer demand Required Qualifications 5+ years of experience launching products in an Agile environment Proficient in SQL, Tableau, Microsoft Azure, and other querying and data visualization tools Proficient in Confluence and JIRA tools Experience with A/B Testing and experimental design Experience defining and tracking product metrics Experience working with data engineering teams to build solutions to expand data ingestion and data pipeline frameworks Experience with leading master data and product information management initiatives to help the Automation products collect, organize, and leverage all their valuable consumer and product data. Highly collaborative with strong communication skills Excellent analytical skills with experience sharing insights in several different mediums from Slack to PowerPoint A high degree of comfort with ambiguity - you are able to quickly develop hypotheses with limited information, test, measure and iterate Self-motivated and willing to handle competing priorities in a fast-paced environment Preferred Qualifications MBA or Technical master's degree Domain knowledge in Customer Service APIs as a product experience At Walmart, we offer competitive pay as well as performance-based incentive awards and other great benefits for a happier mind, body, and wallet. Health benefits include medical, vision and dental coverage. Financial benefits include 401(k), stock purchase and company-paid life insurance. Paid time off benefits include PTO (including sick leave), parental leave, family care leave, bereavement, jury duty, and voting. Other benefits include short-term and long-term disability, company discounts, Military Leave Pay, adoption and surrogacy expense reimbursement, and more. You will also receive PTO and/or PPTO that can be used for vacation, sick leave, holidays, or other purposes. The amount you receive depends on your job classification and length of employment. It will meet or exceed the requirements of paid sick leave laws, where applicable. For information about PTO, see https://one.walmart.com/notices . Live Better U is a Walmart-paid education benefit program for full-time and part-time associates in Walmart and Sam's Club facilities. Programs range from high school completion to bachelor's degrees, including English Language Learning and short-form certificates. Tuition, books, and fees are completely paid for by Walmart. Eligibility requirements apply to some benefits and may depend on your job classification and length of employment. Benefits are subject to change and may be subject to a specific plan or program terms. For information about benefits and eligibility, see One.Walmart at https://bit.ly/3iOOb1J . The annual salary range for this position is $112,000.00-$192,000.00 Additional compensation includes annual or quarterly performance incentives. Additional compensation for certain positions may also include: Regional Pay Zone (RPZ) (based on location) Stock equity incentives Minimum Qualifications... Outlined below are the required minimum qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no minimum qualifications. Option 1: Bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, or related area and 7 years' experience in product management. Option 2: 9 years' experience in product management or related area. Preferred Qualifications... Outlined below are the optional preferred qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no preferred qualifications. Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business Administration, or related area and 6 years' experience as a product manager, ideally working on consumer-facing, large-scale, highly complex B2B/C products Masters: Business Administration, Masters: Computer Engineering, Masters: Computer Science Primary Location... 950 ELM AVE, SAN BRUNO, CA 94066-3047, United States of America
